primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus Christ ascends to the right hand of God to reign over all earthly powers, transforming human history and individual hearts.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus the Son of God reigns over all things
upholding the universe by his word of power
God has planned it that way
The kingdom of this world has become the kingdom of our Lord
God sits upon his holy throne

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Church / The Individual
tekstueel_bewijs: the black South Africans who ordinarily ride the train

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / Faith / Witnesses (Mandela, Tutu)
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit... will be at work
God has enlisted us as partners in faith

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Apartheid, Evil, 'The Devils in Rwanda'
tekstueel_bewijs: the hard truths of human life
the struggle between good and evil... in each individual heart
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The sermon identifies evil as both systemic (apartheid) and ontological (demons in Rwanda/human heart).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the believer to the Ascension through resistance and joy.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Resistance to evil and showing respect
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action is a response to the 'miracle' God has already performed.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He subdues the peoples under us
Jesus the Son of God reigns over all things
God has planned it that way
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We too are given works of faith
we learn to read and watch the news

voorbeelden: nor can we afford to be starry-eyed
deliberately and consciously to rid ourselves of the idea
upholding the universe by his word of power
he... will not let her go

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's power (Pouvoir) to change reality, which then enables the believer's discernment.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Apartheid/Sin) through ~S2 (Mandela's inauguration) to S1 (Christ's Reign).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'already' of Christ's victory breaking into the 'not yet' of human struggle.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the mention of Rwanda and the 'madness in men's hearts' prevents cheap grace.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is deeply theocentric. It uses the political events in South Africa not as a human achievement to be copied, but as a 'miracle' and a sign of Christ's active reign.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: May God grant that we too will resist them... by extra efforts to show respect

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of history
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God planned the whole thing for the feast of the Ascension
When he had made purification for sins, he sat down

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mandela and Tutu are treated as 'witnesses' and 'signs' of God's work, rather than mere moral examples for the hearer to imitate by their own strength.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Tutu's joy is a 'weapon' provided by God.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Encouragement and hope in the face of personal and global evil.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification and sanctification are works of the Ascended Lord.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the geopolitical (South Africa) to the personal (the woman struggling with demons) is seamlessly tied together by the single actant: the reigning Christ.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'miracle' of South Africa and the 'devils' in Rwanda.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ risen and ascended to the right hand of power... Death has no dominion over them.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (power) to resist and the 'Savoir' (discernment) to see God's work.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the primary Subject. The narrative engine is fueled by divine victory rather than human effort.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current emphasis on Pouvoir (God's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'extra efforts to show respect' are explicitly linked to the Spirit's empowerment.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already avoids trivializing evil.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that connects current events to the deep grammar of the Gospel without falling into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the South Africa metaphor; semiotics reveals that Mandela is an adjuvant, not the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Hebrew/Greek of Psalm 47; semiotics focuses on the functional role of 'King' in the present narrative.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model reveals that the 'joy' of the South Africans is actually a modal competence (Pouvoir) given by the Sender (God) to defeat the Opponent (Apartheid).

volledige_subject_lijst: He will not let her go
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'God Squad' quote to playfully but seriously reinforce the actantial role of believers as helpers/messengers of the primary Subject.
